title: Our Events
subtitle: Discover the exciting events organized by Rising Media Club at the University Center of Naama
description: We host a variety of events throughout the academic year, from workshops and training sessions to media exhibitions and collaborative projects. Join us to enhance your skills and connect with fellow media enthusiasts.
noEvents: No upcoming events at the moment. Check back soon!

pastEvents.title: Training Workshop on Radio and Television Presentation and Journalistic Preparation
pastEvents.location: First Pole, Faculty Room, University Center of Naama

specialGuests.name: Dr. Boudwaya Mabkhout
specialGuests.title: Director of the Institute of Humanities and Social Sciences

components.description: Helped members acquire a set of media terminologies and guidance in radio and television presentation and animation
Consisted of direct application for members in news bulletin presentation, program hosting, and voice commentary

pastEvents.description: Our club organized a training workshop on Tuesday, December 3, 2024, at 1:30 PM in the First Pole faculty room on 'Radio and Television Presentation and Journalistic Preparation'. The workshop was led by respected professors Fathi Ayada and Samai Lakhdar, with the attendance of Taibi Sofiane and Azzedine Ben Khadouma. The workshop was also visited by the Director of the Institute of Humanities and Social Sciences, Dr. Boudwaya Mabkhout, who honored us with his encouraging words about the Rising Media Club, provided support and motivation to its members, and appreciated their efforts. The workshop activities included advice from the respected professors and sharing their experience in this field. It included two aspects: a theoretical component that helped members acquire media terminology and guidance in radio and television presentation, and a practical component that involved direct application in news bulletin presentation, program hosting, and voice commentary. The workshop concluded with guidance from the professors, may Allah benefit us with their knowledge and grant them more excellence and brilliance.
